name: Organic Waste
description: Biodegradable waste originating from plants, animals, or food.

name: Plastic Waste
description: Non-biodegradable waste made from synthetic polymers like plastic bottles and bags.

name: Paper Waste
description: Discarded paper materials such as newspapers, cardboard, and office paper.

name: Glass Waste
description: Waste made of glass, including broken glassware and bottles.

name: Metal Waste
description: Discarded metal materials like aluminum cans, scrap iron, and steel items.

name: Electronic Waste (E-Waste)
description: Old or discarded electronic devices such as computers and mobile phones.

name: Hazardous Waste
description: Waste that poses a potential threat to human health or the environment, such as chemicals and medical waste.

name: Biomedical Waste
description: Waste generated from medical and healthcare facilities, such as used syringes and gloves.

name: Construction and Demolition Waste
description: Waste from construction, renovation, or demolition activities like bricks and concrete.

name: Textile Waste
description: Discarded clothing, fabrics, or other textile materials.

name: Municipal Solid Waste (MSW)
description: General waste collected from households and businesses, excluding hazardous materials.

name: Agricultural Waste
description: Waste generated from farming activities, including crop residues and spoiled food.

name: Industrial Waste
description: Waste generated from industrial processes such as slag, chemicals, and factory scraps.

name: Radioactive Waste
description: Hazardous waste containing radioactive materials, such as used nuclear fuel and isotopes.

name: Liquid Waste
description: Waste in liquid form, including sewage and industrial wastewater.

name: Mining Waste
description: Waste generated during the extraction of minerals and metals, such as tailings and overburden.

name: Packaging Waste
description: Materials discarded after the packaging of goods, such as cardboard boxes and Styrofoam.

name: Sludge
description: Semi-solid material generated from water or sewage treatment processes.

name: Chemical Waste
description: Hazardous waste resulting from the use of chemicals in industries and laboratories.

name: Food Waste
description: Discarded food materials from households, restaurants, and food production facilities.
